articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: Republican U.S. presidential candidate Donald Trump and Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris will meet in their first and perhaps only debate on Tuesday, a clash that could prove pivotal in their pitched battle for the White House.
articles.title: Trump, Harris to clash at debate that could reshape 2024 race

articles.author: Khanh Vu, Francesco Guarascio
articles.description: Thousands of residents of Vietnam's capital living close to the swollen Red River were evacuated on Wednesday as its waters flooded streets days after Typhoon Yagi battered Northern Vietnam, killing at least 143 people.
articles.title: Red River floods Hanoi streets as Vietnam reels from impact of Typhoon Yagi

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed at least five people in the West Bank city of Tubas on Wednesday, Palestinian emergency services said, as Israeli security forces continued an extended operation that the military said targeted Iranian-backed militant groups.
articles.title: At least 5 reported killed in West Bank airstrike as Israeli raids continue

articles.author: Filipp Lebedev, Felix Light, Jessica Donati
articles.description: Among the dozens of Wagner mercenaries presumed dead after a lethal battle with Tuareg rebels during a desert sandstorm in Mali in July were Russian war veterans who survived tours in Ukraine, Libya and Syria, according to interviews with relatives and a review of social media data.
articles.title: Exclusive: Wagner lost veteran fighters in Mali ambush, in setback to Russia's Africa campaign

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and British foreign minister David Lammy arrived in Kyiv on Wednesday for a series of meetings with senior Ukrainian government officials at a critical juncture in the war against Russia.
articles.title: Blinken arrives in Ukraine in show of support for Kyiv

articles.author: Antony Paone
articles.description: The testimony of a 71-year-old Frenchman accused of drugging his wife and recruiting dozens of strangers to rape her was postponed on Wednesday after the presiding judge accepted that he was still unwell.
articles.title: Testimony of Frenchman for mass rape of drugged wife postponed again

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Police were pelted with rocks, horse manure and bottles filled with liquid as they tried to protect attendees of a defense expo, some of whom were assaulted by protesters.
articles.title: Melbourne protests: Dozens arrested at defence expo as police clash with demonstrators

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico's Senate gave final approval on Wednesday to a sweeping reform that will reshape the country's judiciary system by electing judges by popular vote, cementing a victory for outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador who has championed the controversial proposal.
articles.title: Mexican Senate gives final approval for judicial reform

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier said on Wednesday that he will form his new government next week, potentially capping one period of political uncertainty ahead of a likely fight over the 2025 budget.
articles.title: French PM Barnier says he will name his government next week

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Devjyot Ghoshal
articles.description: The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) is in talks with Myanmar's ruling junta, its armed opponents and its neighbours to provide cross-border humanitarian assistance into the war-torn country, its chief said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Red Cross pushes for aid corridors into war-torn Myanmar
